description: Under the cover of darkness, a man "harboring hatred" toward Pennsylvania Gov.
title: Arson at Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro's residence exposes potential security failures

description: A Michigan man who was upset that he had to watch pets while his girlfriend’s family went on a cruise was sentenced to eight months in prison Monday for making a false bomb threat.
title: Michigan man upset that girlfriend went on cruise is sent to prison for ship bomb hoax

description: Oops. Vice President and proud Ohio State alum JD Vance tried to help the Buckeyes celebrate their NCAA football championship during a White House visit Monday — but ended up fumbling their trophy.
title: JD Vance fumbles Ohio State's championship trophy during White House visit

description: Tanner Smith, one of the breakout personalities from the Netflix series “Love on the Spectrum,” encapsulates his life philosophy with a simple phrase in his Instagram bio: “Bring the joy.”
title: Tanner’s mom from ‘Love on the Spectrum’ shares scene that made her ‘uncomfortable’

description: As viewers discovered with the second season premiere of “The Last of Us," there’s a raft of new characters to get acquainted with, including one named Eugene.
title: Who is Eugene in ‘The Last of Us’? Mystery character explained

description: Walton Goggins fanned rumors of a feud between him and his “White Lotus” co-star Aimee Lou Wood by responding positively to a “Saturday Night Live” parody of the show that mocked Wood’s appearance.
title: Walton Goggins applauds 'SNL' skit mocking 'White Lotus'

description: Tyra Banks says doing IVF to conceive her son York Banks Asla left her “feeling so inadequate” at times.
title: Tyra Banks recalls 'feeling so inadequate' while going through IVF

description: The next battle for the Senate majority has come into clearer focus in recent weeks, with candidates in both parties making their intentions known in high-profile races across the map.
title: The 2026 Senate map starts to come into focus: From the Politics Desk

description: Another Columbia University student was detained by immigration authorities in “direct retaliation” for his participation in protests against the Israel-Gaza war, his lawyer said Monday.
title: Columbia student detained while attending naturalization ceremony, lawyer says

description: A group of five small businesses on Monday sued President Donald Trump, seeking to block new tariffs that he has imposed on foreign imports in recent weeks.
title: U.S. businesses sue to block Trump tariffs, say trade deficits are not an emergency

description: As President Donald Trump nears the 100-day mark of his second term, recent polling from NBC News shows how he has consolidated the Republican Party not just around himself, but also around his broader “Make America Great Again” movement.
title: Polling shows growing number of Republicans identify with the MAGA movement

description: If an immigrant who the government claims is a gang member can be deported to El Salvador without any due process rights, then why not a U.S. citizen?
title: Trump floats legally questionable proposal to deport U.S. citizens

description: Just eight days after Paige Bueckers led Connecticut to the NCAA championship, the star guard is expected to be selected first overall by Dallas in Monday’s WNBA Draft.
title: WNBA Draft: UConn star Paige Bueckers expected to be taken No. 1 by Dallas Wings

description: The FDA on Monday urged patients and doctors to check that their Ozempic prescriptions are legitimate after the agency seized several hundred fake units of the diabetes drug.
title: FDA warns about fake Ozempic in U.S. supply chain

description: Sean “Diddy” Combs’ attorneys have asked a judge to allow prospective jurors at his upcoming federal sex trafficking and racketeering trial to be questioned about their views on drug and alcohol abuse, sex and violence.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' attorneys want to question jurors about their views on drugs, sex and violence

description: Harvard University will "not accept" demands made by President Donald Trump's administration amid threats of funding cuts, according to a statement issued Monday.
title: Harvard rejects Trump administration demands amid threats of funding cuts

description: During a meeting with President Trump, El Salvador's President Bukule told reporters he will not "smuggle" Kilmar Abrego Garcia into the United States if he is unwanted. The Supreme Court had ordered the Trump administration to "facilitate" Garcia's return.
title: El Salvador's president says he will not return mistakenly deported man to U.S.

description: A person on Monday was apprehended at UnitedHealthcare's campus in Minnesota, police said, more than four months after the company’s CEO was gunned down in New York City.
title: Person arrested outside UnitedHealthcare campus in Minnesota

description: Consumer worries grew over inflation, unemployment and the stock market as the global trade war heated up in March, according to a Federal Reserve Bank of New York survey released Monday.
title: Unemployment fears hit worst levels since Covid as tariffs fuel inflation outlook, Fed survey shows

description: Travelers take note: The federal government says it will start enforcing Real ID requirements at U.S. airports starting May 7 — for real this time.
title: The Real ID deadline is just weeks away. Here's what travelers need to know

description: It’s almost Tax Day in the United States, but several states have automatic deadline extensions in place due to natural disasters in 2024 and 2025.
title: IRS extends April 15 tax deadline for Florida and at least 8 other states. See the list.

description: A growing majority of America’s top executives now expects the U.S. economy to enter a recession in the near future, according to a survey released Monday.
title: More than 60% of CEOs expect a recession in the next 6 months as tariff turmoil grows, survey says

description: A preliminary 5.2-magnitude earthquake struck Julian, California, on Monday, the United States Geological Survey said.
title: 5.2-magnitude earthquake strikes Julian, California, in San Diego County

description: DETROIT — Shares of automakers jumped during midday trading Monday following President Donald Trump saying he’s looking to “help some of the car companies.”
title: Auto stocks rise as Trump says he wants to 'help' some car companies

description: The Phoenix Suns have parted ways with veteran coach Mike Budenholzer following one dismal season that featured a fast start before a maddening slide out of postseason contention for a high-priced roster that included Kevin Durant, Devin Booker and Bradley Beal.
title: Phoenix Suns fire coach Mike Budenholzer after one dismal season

description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele told reporters he would not return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man DOJ said it mistakenly deported to his country.
title: President of El Salvador says he won't return mistakenly deported man to U.S.

description: A Florida woman is facing charges after allegedly buying and selling human bones on Facebook Marketplace.
title: Florida woman charged with selling human bones on Facebook Marketplace

description: An Alabama woman who lived with a pig kidney for a record 130 days had the organ removed after her body began rejecting it and is back on dialysis, doctors announced Friday — a disappointment in the ongoing quest for animal-to-human transplants.
title: Doctors remove pig kidney from an Alabama woman after a record 130 days

description: Several major LGBTQ Pride celebrations lose top sponsors due to DEI-related rollbacks costing $200,000 to $350,000 in funding.
title: Pride organizers say sponsors are pulling back amid DEI rollbacks, economic fears

description: Rumeysa Öztürk, the Tufts University student detained by immigration agents in March detailed the “inhumane” and “unsafe” conditions at the Louisiana facility she is being held in.
title: Tufts student grabbed off street by ICE says hijab removed, asthma not treated at Louisiana facility

description: A San Diego summit offered treatments that promised to help heal autism, a condition the attendees believe is caused by vaccines, though science says otherwise.
title: Inside an anti-vaccine autism summit in the age of RFK Jr.

description: Nvidia is planning to produce AI supercomputer chips entirely in the U.S. for the first time.
title: Nvidia reveals plans to manufacture some AI chips in the U.S.

description: A pill developed by GSK was found to be safe and effective in treating gonorrhea. It could be the first new type of antibiotic for the STI in more than 20 years.
title: A new type of antibiotic is effective against gonorrhea as drug resistance surges

description: A senior Department of Homeland Security official told NBC10 Boston that "notices may have been sent to unintended recipients" and will address issues on a case-by-case basis.
title: DHS told her to leave the country. She's a citizen — and an immigration attorney

description: It seems like King George III was right when he sang “You’ll Be Back”: Leslie Odom Jr.
title: Leslie Odom Jr. announces return to ‘Hamilton’ on Broadway

description: Oklahoma City had a regular season like none other in NBA history.
title: The Thunder's fantastic season was capped off by breaking this record that stood for 50 years

description: A man is now in custody after an alleged arson at the residence of Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro. Police say Cody Balmer scaled a fence to break into the mansion and used a handmade device to start the fire as the governor and his family slept. NBC’s Shaquille Brewster reports for TODAY.
title: Pennsylvania man arrested after governor's residence set on fire

description: Watch live coverage as Blue Origin attempts to launch a rocket with singer Katy Perry and “CBS Mornings” co-host Gayle King among the six-person all-female crew. The flight is autonomous and designed to fly to and from suborbital space without a pilot on board.
title: Blue Origin attempts rocket launch with all-female crew

description: The man charged in connection with starting a fire at Pennsylvania Gov.
title: What we know about arson suspect in fire at PA Gov. Josh Shapiro's residence

description: Today’s female-only spaceflight was the first since 1963, when Valentina Tereshkova of the former Soviet Union became the first woman in space.
title: Blue Origin completes space trip featuring all-female crew

description: Just days after the tragic helicopter crash in New York City killed all six people on board, the FAA says the company involved in the incident, New York City Helicopter Tours, is shutting down their operations immediately. NBC’s Erin McLaughlin reports for TODAY. Warning: Some of the footage may be difficult to watch.
title: NYC helicopter tour company shuts down after deadly crash

description: The death toll is rising following a massive Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian city of Sumy as people had gathered to observe Palm Sunday. At least 34 have been killed, including two children. The attack comes just days after President Donald Trump's Russia envoy met with Vladimir Putin in St. Petersburg discussing what the Kremlin called "a Ukraine settlement." NBC’s Keir Simmons reports for TODAY.
title: Russia launches strikes during Palm Sunday gathering in Ukraine

description: The humanitarian crisis in Gaza is worsening amid Israel’s nearly month-and-a-half long blockage of goods into the enclave. An NBC News crew in Gaza documented how Palestinians are struggling with food and medicine shortages and ramped up Israeli airstrikes.
title: Humanitarian crisis in Gaza worsens amid Israeli blockade

description: Just days after the Trump administration announced some electronics like smartphones, laptops and computer chips would be exempt from steep tariffs, the President is now walking that back and suggesting the products are moving to a different tariff bucket. NBC’s Gabe Gutierrez reports for TODAY.
title: Trump's policy reversal causes confusion over tariff exemptions

description: A Santa Monica man was arrested Saturday around 12:15 p.m. after he threatened to bomb the Coachella Music & Arts Festival, the Cathedral City Police Department said.
title: Man who threatened to bomb Coachella is arrested in Palm Springs

description: Former Rep. Mike Rogers, R-Mich., launched another campaign for Senate on Monday, the first major Republican candidate to jump into the race.
title: GOP former Rep. Mike Rogers launches another Michigan Senate run

description: Members of Congress are back in their districts for a two-week recess, potentially bracing for more anger from constituents.
title: Republicans set to largely avoid town halls during the congressional recess

description: Former LSU receiver Kyren Lacy has died at age 24 in an apparent suicide in his car while being pursued by authorities in Houston, according to a Harrison County sheriff’s report released Sunday.
title: Ex-LSU receiver Kyren Lacy died in an apparent suicide during a police chase, authorities say

description: Peruvian author Mario Vargas Llosa, Nobel literature laureate and a giant of Latin American letters, died Sunday.
title: Mario Vargas Llosa, Peruvian author and Nobel literature laureate, dies at 89

description: President Donald Trump has moved quickly on his far-reaching agenda, but his administration has frequently changed both its messaging and its course.
title: Chaos, confusion and reversals: The story of Trump's second term so far

description: As Democratic voters say their party needs to change and young voters grow more skeptical of traditional party politics, a crop of candidates in their 20s and 30s is stepping in to challenge older Democrats for their seats in Congress.
title: Young voters' indignation at older leaders spurs Democratic primary challenges

description: The company that operated the helicopter that crashed into the Hudson River in New York last week, killing all six people on board, will shut down immediately, the Federal Aviation Administration said late Sunday.
title: New York helicopter company shutting down following crash that killed 6

description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday said he would be announcing the tariff rate on imported semiconductors over the next week, adding that there would be flexibility with some companies in the sector.
title: Tariffs on imported semiconductor chips coming soon, Trump says

description: The family of Erik and Lyle Menendez is calling for the L.A. County DA's Office to be removed from the brothers' case after they claimed the use of a graphic photo in a court hearing caused the brothers' aunt to be hospitalized.
title: Menendez brothers' family blames graphic courtroom photo for aunt's hospitalization

description: No survivors were reported after a private plane crashed while it was preparing for a second landing attempt in New York's Columbia County on Saturday, officials said.
title: No survivors reported after plane with 6 aboard crashes in New York

description: As another AI-driven trend gained traction, artists countered by sharing their own human-made takes on the ChatGPT-generated action figures that circulated online in recent days.
title: AI-generated action figures were all over social media. Then, artists took over with hand-drawn versions.
